intro: Matelea fimbriata, commonly known as the fringe-flowered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to red in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while the stems are usually hairy. Matelea fimbriata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native range.
